column4: is there a kernel parameter to disabled sound completely? I really don't like having to blacklist a ton of sound modules..
why disable sounds in the kernel? ... just don't start alsa ... or mute it
also make sure to disable the pcspkr module
because i want to disable sound....
if you hate the "beep" at the console ... it does not stop by disabling the sound
look bro, this is a server
If you're worried about bloat, then why don't you just compile your own kernel with only the required modules?
if it is a server, it will probably not produce sound anyways ... and since you do not have alsa etc installed (since you hate bloat) ... I wonder what is the point
like I said soundcore will only disable your "soundcard" sound ... not the beeper on the motherboard (which can still produce very ennoying sounds)
k ... but please enlighten my why you want to disable sound on your server? (genuinely interested curious as I never gave it any thought)
never had the need of a "few mb" of ram on a server for a long time ... and when I did, I ran my custom kernels (which frees up a lot more than just a few mb)
right, like i said though i'd rather a 5 minute optimization versus a new kernel :)
anyways ... good to see some people are still motivated to get a few percent more out of their systems
I gave up on that when I noticed it is cheaper to throw more hardware at it (clustering etc)
